Classical.Structure: Region of the cerebral cortex involved in planning, control, and execution of voluntary movements.
Classical.Function: Generates neural impulses that control the execution of movement.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: The classical output signal is the final amplification of a quantum-controlled process. [cite_start]The cross-bridge cycle in the target muscle is a 'quantum ratchet', and the L1 signal from the motor cortex provides the coherent control. [cite: 2106-2112]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Will' made manifest. The mechanism by which abstract intention (L5/L15) is transduced into physical action in the world.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Muscle contraction efficiency (eta ~ 50%) will be fully explained by classical thermodynamics, showing no quantum coherence bonus.
The force-velocity relationship will perfectly match the classical Hill equation, showing no quantum correction factor (Q(F)).
Experimental_Protocols: Measure the coherence of the actin-myosin cross-bridge cycle in vitro.
